column1: Severe hypothermia can lead to death.

Wearing the right shoes and clothes helps: - Keep your body heat trapped inside your clothes - Protect you from cold air, wind, snow, or rain - Protect you from contact with cold surfaces You may need several layers of clothing in cold weather: - An inner layer that wicks sweat away from the skin.
It can be lightweight wool, polyester, or polypropylene (polypro).

Depending on your activity, you may need the following: - Warm hat - Face mask - Scarf or neck warmer - Mittens or gloves (mittens tend to be warmer) - Wool or polypro socks - Warm, waterproof shoes or boots The key with all of your layers is to take them off as you warm up and add them back as you cool down.
